PPP: Menag Harus Mampu Jelaskan Korelasi Cadar dengan Radikalisme
01 Nov 2019, 16:57 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR).- Wacana Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi yang hendak mengkaji pelarangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di lingkungan instansi pemerintah dipertanyakan Partai Persatuan Pembangunan. Wakil Sekjen PPP Ahmad Baidowi Menteri Agama perlu menjelaskan serinci mungkin mengenai kaitan antara cara berpakaian dengan pemahaman yang dianut seseorang.
Melalui siaran persnya, Jumat, 1 November 2019, legislator yang akrab disapa Awiek ini menilai kebijakan tersebut berpotensi melanggar HAM meski dari perspektif keamanan bisa saja dibenarkan. Menag juga perlu menyosialisasikan secara utuh apakah aturan ini akan diterapkan bagi pegawai negeri sipil (PNS) di instansi pemerintahan, lingkungan Kementerian Agama saja, atau bagi masyarakat umum.
“Menag harus menjelaskan kepada publik terkait korelasi cara berpakaian terhadap radikalisme, agar persoalan menjadi jernih," kata Awiek.
PPP, lanjutnya, tidak keberatan jika cadar dilarang bagi PNS di lingkungan Kementerian Agama saja. Sementara jika ingin diterapkan bagi PNS seluruh instansi pemerintahan, Kementerian Agama tidak memiliki kewenangan kecuali ada kebijakan dari Kementerian Pendayagunaan Aparatur Negara-Reformasi Birokrasi.
"Mengingat tupoksi Kemenag hanya berwenang mengatur ASN di internal," kata dia
Awiek juga menegaskan jangan sampai pelarangan ini diartikan menjauhkan sebagian pihak dari semangat ke-Islaman. “Jangan sampai larangan penggunaan cadar dipahami sebagai larangan penggunaan jilbab, karena tingkat pemahaman masyarakat tidak merata," ucap dia.***

PPP: The Minister of Religion Must Be Able To Explain The Correlation Of Veils With Radicalism
Nov 01 2019, 16:57 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR) .- The discourse of the Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi who wants to study the prohibition of veils and circumferential pants in government agencies is questioned by the United Development Party. Deputy Secretary General of PPP Ahmad Baidowi Minister of Religion needs to explain in as much detail as possible the link between how to dress with the understanding adopted by someone.
Through its press release, Friday, November 1, 2019, the legislator who is familiarly called Awiek assessed that the policy had the potential to violate human rights even though from a security perspective it could be justified. The Minister of Religion also needs to fully socialize whether this regulation will be applied to civil servants (PNS) in government agencies, the Ministry of Religion only, or to the general public.
"The Minister of Religion must explain to the public the correlation between how to dress and radicalism, so that the problem becomes clear," said Awiek.
PPP, he continued, would not mind if the veil was banned for civil servants within the Ministry of Religion alone. Meanwhile, if you want to be applied to civil servants all government agencies, the Ministry of Religion does not have authority unless there is a policy from the Ministry of Administrative Reform and Bureaucracy Reform.
"Considering that the Ministry of Religion is only authorized to regulate ASN internally," he said
Awiek also stressed that this ban should not be interpreted as alienating some parties from the Islamic spirit. "Don't let the veil ban be understood as a ban on the veil, because the level of community understanding is uneven," he said. ***
